info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 2:44PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN BROWN, SOUTHWESTERN CLINTON AND WESTERN HIGHLAND COUNTIES THROUGH 315 PM EDT... At 244 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Mount Orab, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Hillsboro, Blanchester, Mount Orab, Lynchburg, Sardinia, Russell, New Market, Martinsville, Mowrystown, Fayetteville, Midland, St. Martin, Chasetown, Greenbush, Buford and Westboro. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
